com.androidquery.callback
Class AbstractAjaxCallback<T,K>

java.lang.Object
  com.androidquery.callback.AbstractAjaxCallback<T,K>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AjaxCallback, BitmapAjaxCallback
public abstract class AbstractAjaxCallback<T,K>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The core class of ajax callback handler.

weakHandler

public K weakHandler(java.lang.Object handler,
                     java.lang.String callback)
Set a callback handler with a weak reference. Use weak handler if you do not want the ajax callback to hold the handler object from garbage collection. For example, if the handler is an activity, weakHandler should be used since the method shouldn't be invoked if an activity is already dead and garbage collected.

Parameters:
handler - the handler
callback - the callback
Returns:
self

handler

public K handler(java.lang.Object handler,
                 java.lang.String callback)
Set a callback handler. See weakHandler for handler objects, such as Activity, that should not be held from garbaged collected.

Parameters:
handler - the handler
callback - the callback
Returns:
self

Url.

Parameters:
url - the url
Returns:
self

type

public K type(java.lang.Class<T> type)
Set the desired ajax response type. Type parameter is required otherwise the ajax callback will not occur. Current supported type: JSONObject.class, String.class, byte[].class, Bitmap.class, XmlDom.class

Parameters:
type - the type
Returns:
self

fileCache

public K fileCache(boolean cache)
Set ajax request to be file cached.

Parameters:
cache - the cache
Returns:
self

memCache

public K memCache(boolean cache)
Indicate ajax request to be memcached. Note: The default ajax handler does not supply a memcache. Subclasses such as BitmapAjaxCallback can provide their own memcache.

Parameters:
cache - the cache
Returns:
self

refresh

public K refresh(boolean refresh)
Indicate the ajax request should ignore memcache and filecache.

Parameters:
refresh - the refresh
Returns:
self

expire

public K expire(long expire)
The expire duation for filecache. If a cached copy will be served if a cached file exists within current time minus expire duration.

Parameters:
expire - the expire
Returns:
self

header

public K header(java.lang.String name,

Returns:

param

public K param(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.Object value)
Set http POST params. If params are set, http POST method will be used. The UTF-8 encoded value.toString() will be sent with POST. Header field "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded;charset=UTF-8" will be added if no Content-Type header field presents.

Parameters:
name - the name
value - the value
Returns:
self

params

public K params(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
Set the http POST params. See param(String name, Object value).

Parameters:
params - the params
Returns:
self

Parameters:
view - the progress view
Returns:
self

              java.lang.String type,
              java.lang.String account)

Parameters:
act - the current activity
type - the auth type
account - the account, such as someone@gmail.com
Returns:
